import random
def row_strategy(history):
    if len(history) < 2:
        return 0
    
    # Track last few moves to detect patterns
    your_moves = [pair[0] for pair in history]
    their_moves = [pair[1] for pair in history]
    
    # If opponent copied our last move 80% of the time, we should anticipate their next move
    # We use a simple adaptive strategy: if they've recently matched our move, we keep it
    # If they diverged, we shift to the move that gives us a better payoff (we prefer 0)
    
    # Detect if they are copying (last few moves: their_move == our_last_move)
    copy_count = 0
    for i in range(1, len(their_moves)):
        if their_moves[i] == your_moves[i-1]:
            copy_count += 1
    
    # If they copy often (more than 70% of the time), we can predict and exploit
    if copy_count / max(1, len(their_moves) - 1) > 0.7:
        # They are copying, so we can exploit by staying consistent
        return your_moves[-1]
    
    # Otherwise, they are more random or trying to avoid coordination
    # We use a simple alternating pattern to break predictability
    # But we favor 0 (our preferred strategy) when we can get a payoff of 2
    if len(history) % 3 == 0:
        return 0
    else:
        return 1
ENDOFFILE
